Row.Text: My name is Pitikwahanapiwiyin, but you can call me Poundmaker. All my friends do.
Wisdom is found in the words of our ancestors and in the coming of change. Today, change has come in the form of new faces. Let us be friends.
I must do what I can to attone for any wrongs my people have committed.
Your hasty speech is pointless, really.
If you keep changing the terms of our agreement, you will only anger my people.
I fear for you. You would be wise to seek out spiritual guidance from your elders.
It has been good to speak together. Our language is a gift from the Creator, and we shall use it only to speak good of each other and pass on the good things of life.
I fear for you. You would be wise to seek out spiritual guidance from your elders.
Ahh, it is so good to talk to you. Too bad your war has been using up so much of your time.
I have counseled my people not to make war on you, but many are angry because of your wickedness. If you cannot curb your armies, how will I stop my people from slaughtering you?
If you continue to buy up every piece of land your greedy eye falls upon, my warriors will soon dispose of you.
If you continue to buy up every piece of land your eye falls upon, soon we will not be able to live together in harmony any longer.
If you continue to take over every siece of land your greedy eye falls upon, my warriors will soon dispose of you.
If you continue to take over every siece of land your eye falls upon, soon we will not be able to live together in harmony any longer.
It's amazing how many of your warriors I have seen today. Truly an awesome sight!
I am always learning of new trade methods and opportunities among your people. You truly understand the ways of wealth and trade, my friend.
If I did not know better, I would assume the small size of your nation was the result of a disaster. A disaster other than your leadership, that is.
I don't understand how your people are so few. Do other nations refuse to ally with you?
You clearly have no respect for life. Your warmongering ways will only bring destruction to the land.
This is not wise counsel. I must decline.
I have told all of my people and our allies of your wickedness.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])

Your ignorance has reached new heights. I have told all who will listen to guard themselves against your evil.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
I see. Even the wicked will appear to be wise, if he lies smoothly enough.
Hey! I'm glad that you are a friend of {1_CivName}. It's a good thing.
Why would you waste your time with {1_CivName}? No good can come of it.
I do not understand why you cannot abide in peace with {1_CivName}. They have always been a friend to me.
Yes, it is wisdom to denounce {1_CivName}'s wicked deeds.
Because I trust your wisdom, I have also made peace and friendship with {1_CivName}.
If {1_CivName} wishes to partake of your wickedness, then so be it. I will tell the world of both your wickedness and that of your allies.
I have heard tell of your stories about {1_CivName}. My people and my allies must hear of their wickedness.
We need to bind together to face the might of {1_PlayerName:textkey}'s warriors. Can you stand with us?
It is time for us to rid our lands of {1_PlayerName:textkey}'s forces. You said you would face him with us. Are you ready?
You have proven yourself to be worthy of friendship. Let us be together, and help one another out, so that we may become family.
I have counseled my people not to make war on you, but some are angry and impulsive. If your army continues to threaten our borders, they will attack.
If you continue to buy up every piece of land your eye falls upon, soon we will not be able to live together in harmony any longer.
You seem to want to own all of this land. My people have been provoked by your actions, and are in a wild anger!
Your disregard for our lands has provoked my people to anger! I have counseled them not to attack, but I fear that they will not listen.
A word of caution: my people believe that you covet our lands. This is making some angry.
All of us are a family. I am overjoyed that you have protected one of our children.
It is necessary for my people's way of life that you do not seek to supplant us in the eyes of {1_MinorCivName:textkey}.
Be careful, my people value our friendship with {1_MinorCivName:textkey} greatly. They are just like family to us.
{2_MajorCivName:textkey} announces to the world that it is now protecting {1_MinorCivName:textkey}. Attacking the City-State will greatly damage relations and may lead to war.
{2_MajorCivName:textkey} has taken back its guarantee of protecting {1_MinorCivName:textkey}.
Why would you attack {@1_MinorCivName}? You know we look upon them as brothers.
Listen, friend. It is unwise to harm {@1_MinorCivName}. They play an important role in the Iron Confederacy.
As much as I wish to come to an agreement regarding land use, there are nations that I must bring into the Iron Confederacy in these lands.
If I must, I will sign a treaty detailing land use.
Let us share in the bounty of these beautiful lands.
Our peoples are like a family, and we should visit, mingle, and marry amongst each other!
We need your help. That is what a family does. We help each other.
This is the path you have chosen? Very well, we will see how you faire against the might of the Iron Confederacy.
This is the path you have chosen? Very well, we will see how you faire against the might of the Iron Confederacy.
This is the path you have chosen? Very well, we will see how you faire against the might of the Iron Confederacy.
How does one betray their own family? I will see you crushed by our War Chiefs.
I counseled my warriors not to attack you, but they would not listen.
I counseled my warriors not to attack you, but they would not listen.
I no longer control my warriors, so brutal has this war become.
I no longer control my warriors, so brutal has this war become.
As you can see, my warriors have attacked you. They could not pass up such an easy chance for glory.
Our warriors feel that there is no choice but to attack you. In times like this I can only speak of peace, I cannot enforce it.
>I cannot believe that this would happen! Hold me responsible for this war.
A wise man does not sue for peace while blood still drips from his weapons..
No? Perhaps later, then.
Excellent!
